page.title: 14ECOLOGY(1)
page.content: Most of the area lies between 400ft and 800ft on limestone and clays. The average rainfall in Campden is 28ins or 711 m.m.and the average no of days on which precipitation occurs is 147. The daily Winter maximum temperature is 6.8 Celsius and the average daily summer temperature is 22.5 C. The wettest month is January;the driest is August. The first damaging frosts occur in October and the last in late May. Snowfall averages 4 days p.a. but between 71 and 77 there was no snow cover. Thunderstorms are infrequent - about 3 p.a. on average mostly coming from the S.E. Fogs occur but usually are of limited duration and more often on the high ground.In recent years the occurence of long cold Springs has upset farming and horticulture. The valley of the Cam is liable to serious flooding during heavy (65 m.m.) rain.
